meanings.definition: The quality of being pleasant or easy to like.
meanings.sent1: Her likeability made everyone enjoy her company.
meanings.sent2: The puppy's likeability made it a favorite among the children.
meanings.sent3: His likeability was so high that even grumpy cats couldn't resist him.
meanings.sent4: The likeability of the new teacher shone brighter than the sun.
meanings.sent5: The likeability of the song was infectious, making everyone hum along.

meanings.definition: The degree to which someone or something is liked or approved of by others.
meanings.sent1: The candidate's likeability played a crucial role in winning the election.
meanings.sent2: The movie's likeability determined its success at the box office.
meanings.sent3: The likeability of the dessert was evident from the empty plates.
meanings.sent4: Her likeability was a magnet that drew people towards her.
meanings.sent5: The likeability of the idea sparked enthusiasm among the team members.
